openSource.title: Open Source
openSource.description: LocaleDB est enti√®rement gratuit et open source. Vous pouvez utiliser ces donn√©es dans vos projets sans restrictions. Le code source et les donn√©es sont disponibles sur GitHub sous licence MIT.

hero.title: Global Data for Modern Apps
hero.subtitle: LocaleDB is a comprehensive, open-source database of localization data for developers building international applications. We aggregate and process data from authoritative sources including CLDR, ISO standards, and OpenFlights.

cta.title: Open Source & Community Driven
cta.description: LocaleDB is MIT licensed and welcomes contributions. Whether you're fixing a typo, adding a missing country, or improving the UI, we'd love your help.

fixData.title: Fix Data
fixData.description: Correct typos or update outdated locale information.

addCountry.title: Add Country
addCountry.description: Add missing countries using standard codes.

improveCode.title: Improve Code
improveCode.description: Enhance the UI, search, or build scripts.

step1.title: Fork & Setup
step1.description: Fork the <link>GitHub repository</link> and clone it to your local machine.

step2.title: Use Data Overrides
step2.description: To fix data, do not edit the generated files in /data/countries/. Instead, create or edit a file in /data/overrides/XX.json (where XX is the country code).

step3.title: Verify & Submit
step3.description: Run the build script to verify your changes are merged correctly. Then submit a Pull Request with references to official sources.

help.title: Need Help?
help.description: Have a question or stuck on a step? Start a discussion on GitHub.

footer.description: Donn√©es de localisation gratuites et open source pour les d√©veloppeurs.

roadmap.title: Project Roadmap
roadmap.subtitle: LocaleDB's development journey and future plans.

1.title: Project Initiation & Data Population
1.description: Initial setup of the Next.js project and population of core data for countries, currencies, and languages.

2.title: Bug Fixes & Contribution System
2.description: Resolving initial issues and establishing a robust workflow for community contributions via overrides.

3.title: Data Export Interface
3.description: A user interface allowing users to select specific countries and export their data in custom JSON formats.

4.title: npm Package & CLI Tool
4.description: A dedicated npm package and CLI tool for developers to download and integrate locale data directly into their projects.

5.title: Public API Launch
5.description: Development and deployment of a RESTful API to serve locale data dynamically.
